Updated November     pm



For most ECU students having a solo exhibition at the local museum seems like a dream but for senior Kelly Wheeler that dream is now a reality PERIOD

Wheeler will host her Senior Exhibition at the Greenville Museum of Art which will showcase the work she has accomplished within the last five years while working with ECUs School of Art and Design PERIOD

Wheelers show titled  is composed of ceramic and mixed media artwork and focuses on illustrating her life and all that she has overcome PERIOD

As a child she was diagnosed with leukemia leaving her challenged by many obstacles that most children could never imagine facing PERIOD

 she said PERIOD 

Although this show is her largest yet Wheeler isnt a stranger to the world of art exhibitions PERIOD Ever since  she has participated in the School of Art and Designs undergraduate show and her work was showcased in a show at the Emerge Gallery last year PERIOD

While getting ready for her exhibition Wheeler is also busy pursuing her masters degree in art therapy PERIOD After graduation she hopes to work at a hospital with children who have been diagnosed with cancer PERIOD

Wheeler admits that it can sometimes be overwhelming working on a solo show while still being a fulltime student trying to earn her degree PERIOD However she understands that all her hard work is worth it and has some advice for students new to ECUs School of Art and Design PERIOD

 Wheeler says PERIOD

Wheelers solo exhibition opened on Oct PERIOD  at and will show through Nov PERIOD  at the Greenville Museum of Art located on Evans Street across from Hams PERIOD All ECU students are encouraged to come out and see what all the artists have accomplished PERIOD

This writer can be contacted at pulsetheeastcarolinian.com PERIOD
